bibl.title: Letter from E. L. Hamilton to Elihu Root, October 25, 1901

div1.p: Hamilton requests that Root detail Walter Reed to attend a medical conference in Ann Arbor, Michigan, in order to present a paper on his yellow fever research. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

OFFICE
Secretary of War.
Sir:-
div1.p:
On the 21st. and 22nd. of November, the health officers
of the State of Michigan will hold a conference at Ann Arbor.
They very much desire to have with them Major Walter Reed, U. S. A.
in order that he may give them in a paper the benefit of his
researches on yellow fever. You will do these gentlemen, as well
as myself, a great favor if you can detail Dr. Reed to attend this
conference.
